quotes.body: A most notable coward, an infinite and endless liar, an hourly promise breaker, the owner of no one good quality.
quotes.citation: All’s Well That Ends Well (Act 3, Scene 6)

quotes.body: Away, you starvelling, you elf-skin, you dried neat’s-tongue, bull’s-pizzle, you stock-fish!
Come, come, you froward and unable worms!
quotes.citation: The Taming Of The Shrew (Act 5, Scene 2)

quotes.body: Go, prick thy face, and over-red thy fear, Thou lily-liver’d boy.
His wit’s as thick as a Tewkesbury mustard.
I am pigeon-liver’d and lack gall.
I am sick when I do look on thee.
I must tell you friendly in your ear, sell when you can, you are not for all markets.
If thou wilt needs marry, marry a fool; for wise men know well enough what monsters you make of them.
I’ll beat thee, but I would infect my hands.
Methink’st thou art a general offence and every man should beat thee.
quotes.citation: All’s Well That Ends Well (Act 2, Scene 3)

quotes.body: More of your conversation would infect my brain.
Aroint thee: go away, rump-fed runion: slut
The rankest compound of villainous smell that ever offended nostril
quotes.citation: The Merry Wives of Windsor (Act 3, Scene 5)
